text:
Hi,

I am having problems with log4j-1.2rc1.
I replaced b4 with rc1 and now my context specific logging is quite messed up. 
My logs are now filling up with garbage characters and after each context 
reload another level of [what is in the square brackets in the 
conversionPattern] is added. 

log4j.appender.M1.layout.ConversionPattern=%-5p [%d{ABSOLUTE},%c{2}]%n%m%n

e.g. when the context starts a log entry would look like:
INFO  [16:10:01,350,ServiceControl]  Initializing 1 MBeans

after a reload the entry looks like:
INFO  [16:10:01,350,Default]  [INFO,ServiceControl] Initializing 1 MBeans

after a second reload the entry looks like:
INFO  [16:15:33,210,Default]  [INFO,Default] [INFO,ServiceControl] Initializing 
1 MBeans

plus a great deal of gargage is now showing up in the log.

This worked with log4j 1.2b4.

given that 1.13, 1.2b4 and 1.2rc1 all have different interfaces it's difficult 
to track this down.
creator: brett.knights@tanner.com
brett.knights@tanner.com
text:
Anyway this appeared to work with 1.2b4.  :-\

The problem is how the org.jboss.logging.log4j.ConsoleAppender reloads 
initializes its streams when reloaded as part of a jmx application.
